item.title: Large Pavement pothole and Flooding when it rains, 14th February
item.description:
Over multiple recent periods of rainfall, the road drainage gullies within Shuttle Close have failed to cope with surface water and appear to be blocked. This is now resulting in significant flooding across the road directly outside our property. The flooding regularly forms large standing pools of water which extend across our driveway entrance and flood the public pavement. Water has reached depths of approximately 6 inches and on several occasions we have been unable to walk from our driveway to the pavement without entering standing water. The water is also running down our driveway and into our property boundary. This is no longer simply an inconvenience and has now caused damage. We recently installed a new driveway at a cost of just over £25,000. Due to the flooding, silt and debris are being washed from the road onto the driveway and it is becoming damaged and stained. Additionally, we have electric driveway gates which have now required three separate engineer call-outs due to water ingress damage, at a cost of approximately £300 per visit. I must also report a separate highways safety concern. The pavement immediately outside our property has sunk over an area of approximately 1 square metre, to a depth of around 4–6 inches. This presents a clear trip hazard to pedestrians and also causes vehicles to jolt when entering or leaving our driveway. We have photographic evidence documenting both the flooding and the pavement defect and can provide this upon request. Given the risk to public safety, ongoing property damage and potential liability, please treat this as a formal notification of a highway defect under the council’s duty to maintain the highway and drainage infrastructure. We would be grateful if an urgent inspection could be arranged and if you could confirm a reference number for this report together with the proposed timescale for investigation and remedial works.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 48, Shuttle Close, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flooding in garage area, 14th February
item.description:
Two soak away drains need unblocking, taking forever, days in fact to soak away any water from the near constant rain we have had of late, resulting in the garage area being flooded. Not helped I guess by the nearby building site and the run off of mud from that.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Sewell Road, Abbey Wood

item.title: Overhanging trees obstructing public highway, 14th February
item.description:
Highways Act 1980 (Section 154) Overhanging trees onto public highway causing danger and obstruction to pedestrians. Located on a busy route providing access to Beths grammar school, dangerous for children. Issue has been previously reported by others but no action taken, situation worse.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2A, Parkhurst Road, Bexley, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
